name: diazole-compound production | diazole-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/180/documentation

This dataset represents the production of diazole-compounds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation.  Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursors (acetic anhydride, ammonia, bromine, chlorine, ethylene, ethylene oxide, formaldehyde, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen, nitric acid, oxygen, phenol, phosgene, 1-propanol, sodium hydroxide, sodium hypochlorite, trichloromethane, "water, salt, sole", and xylene) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with  diazole-compounds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Diazole-compounds are a group of pesticides with a five-membered ring consisting of three carbon atoms and two nitrogen atoms (C3H4N2). Diazoles are produced by adding a diazole ring to a halo-compound.; ;The dataset diazole-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of prochloraz and metazachlor.;;Prochloraz is produced in five steps from phenol:;C6H6O + 3 Cl2 → C6H3Cl3O + 3 HCl;C6H3Cl3O + C2H4Br2 → C8H6Cl3BrO + HBr;C8H6Cl3BrO + C3H9N → C11H14Cl3NO + HBr;C11H14Cl3NO + COCl2 → C12H14Cl4NO2 + HCl;C12H14Cl4NO2 + C3H4N2 → C15H16Cl3N3O2 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the prochloraz production are ethylene bromide (C2H4Br2) and imidazole (C3H4N2).;;Ethylene bromide (C2H4Br2) is produced from ethylene and bromine:;C2H6 + 2 Br2 → C2H4Br2 + 2 HBr;;Imidazole (C3H4N2) is produced in two steps from ethylene oxide:;C2H4O + O2 → C2H2O + H2O;C2H2O + 2 NH3 + CH2O → C3H4N2 + 3 H2O;;Metazachlor is produced in five steps from xylene:;C8H10 + HNO3 → C8H9NO2 + H2O;C6H5N3O4 + H2 → C8H11N + H2O;C8H11N + C2H3Cl2O → C10H14NClO + HCl;3 C10H12NClO + C3H6O3 + 3 HCl → 3 C11H14NCl2O + 3 H2O;C11H14NCl2O + C3H4N2 → C14H16ClN3O + HCl;Precursors that are used for the metazachlor production are chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O), paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3), pyrazole (C3H4N2), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Chloroacetyl chloride (C2H2Cl2O) is produced in two steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + SOCl2 → C2H2Cl2O + HCl + SO2;;Paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3) is produced from formaldehyde:;3 CH2O → C3H6O3;;Pyrazole (C3H4N2) is produced in four steps from sodium hypochlorite:;NaOCl + NH3 → NH2Cl + NaOH;NH2Cl + NaOH + NH3 → N2H4 + NaCl + H2O;N2H4 + CHCl3 → CH2N2 + 3 HCl;CH2N2 + C2H4 → C3H4N2 + H2;;Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is produced in two steps from sulphur:;S + Cl2 → SCl2;SCl2 + SO2 + Cl2 → 2 SOCl2

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Diazoles can have different modes of action. Prochloraz, which is an fungicide, acts in C14- demethylase in sterol biosynthesis (erg11/cyp51); and metazachlor, which is an herbicide, acts as an inhibitor of sythesis of very long fatty acids

exchanges.description:
There is an intermediate containing bromine in this process and this input is used as an input in the bromine production.

The concentration of bromine in water, salt, sole is 0.23% = 0.0023kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.25% (Ullmann's encyclopedia), 0.4% (USGS). The concentration of iodine in water, salt, sole is 0.03% = 0.0003kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.015% - 0.12% (Ullmann's encyclopedia).
There is an intermediate containing bromine in this process and this input is used as an input in the bromine production.

The concentration of bromine in water, salt, sole is 0.23% = 0.0023kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.25% (Ullmann's encyclopedia), 0.4% (USGS). The concentration of iodine in water, salt, sole is 0.03% = 0.0003kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.015% - 0.12% (Ullmann's encyclopedia).

flow.name: Acetic acid
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that includes 50% natural gas.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

Further references:

Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Estimation, based on a production capacity of 50,000 t per year and a plant life time of 50 years, therefore an amount of 4X10-10 units per kg of produced chemical  is aded to the unit process of the respective chemical. The amount is accounted for each production step. This might be an overestimation in some multistep syntheses.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

Further references:

Kim S., Overcash M.: Energy in chemical manufacturing processes: gate-to-gate information for life cycle assessment. In: Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology vol. 78,  no. 9: 995-1005(11). 2003
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE
